i5.las2peer.persistency

Class Envelope

  • java.lang.Object
    • i5.las2peer.persistency.Envelope
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    XmlAble, java.lang.Cloneable

    public final class Envelope
extends java.lang.Object
implements XmlAble, java.lang.Cloneable
    An envelope provides a secure storage for any serializable content within the LAS2peer network. The content will be encrypted symmetrically, the key for opening the envelope will be provided to all entitled Agents via asymmetrical encryption. All encrypted versions of the decryption key are part of the envelope itself. The serialization of the content may be implemented via simple java serialization or the XmlAble facilities of las2peer.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Envelope.ContentType
      Type of the content inside the envelope.

      • getId

      • setOverWriteBlindly

        public void setOverWriteBlindly(boolean overwrite)
                         throws L2pSecurityException
        May this envelope be overwritten by envelopes not knowing this state? By default, blindly overwriting is turned off. In this case, another envelope trying to replace this one, has to refer to the timestamp of this envelope suggesting to be an updated version. Otherwise a replacement will fail with an L2pSecurityException.
        Parameters:
        overwrite -
        Throws:
        L2pSecurityException

      • getOverwriteBlindly

        public boolean getOverwriteBlindly()
        may this envelope be overwritten without reference to the existing one?
        Returns:
        true, if overwrite is allowed

      • checkOverwrite

        public void checkOverwrite(Envelope envelope)
                    throws L2pSecurityException
        check, if the current envelope may be overwritten by the given one. If the current envelope is not signed, overwriting is permitted. Otherwise, the new envelope must contain at least one signature of the signing agents if this envelope. If overwriting is not allowed, a L2pSecurityException is thrown
        Parameters:
        envelope -
        Throws:
        L2pSecurityException
